job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Implementation at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Implementation transforms new customers into power users. We lead the onboarding experience for companies adopting Brex Empower, helping them shift from outdated processes to a modern, employee-first approach. It’s a role that blends customer empathy, project management, technical expertise, process design, and change management. We take personal ownership of our customers&#39; long-term success, and we set customers up thoroughly so they can be with ‘Brex for life’. As strategic advisors, we build trust, drive solutions with tenacity, deliver results fast, and work cross-functionally to make adoption seamless for customers.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;As an Enterprise Implementation Consultant, you will serve as a strategic advisor to our largest customers, guiding them through a successful launch of the Brex platform. Acting as a hybrid coach, project manager, and product expert, your primary goals will be to drive wide product adoption, deliver ongoing business value, and help customers transform their financial workflows.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you’ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our Seattle office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Lead and project manage end-to-end global enterprise implementations and launches. This includes scoping customer outcomes, creating project plans, mobilizing stakeholders, configuring and testing the platform, and overseeing accounting software integrations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Serve as a strategic consultant by working closely with customers to discover their business needs, leading design workshops, and coaching them on how to best use Brex to solve their challenges.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Drive customer success and adoption by developing strategies to ramp up spending activity, and providing global change management planning to guide clients on their communication approach, training materials, and execution.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Manage and cultivate customer relationships by building multi-threaded connections from senior leaders to day-to-day stakeholders, managing expectations, and working diligently to provide solutions to any challenges.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Act as a key cross-functional partner within the Brex account team, collaborating with Sales, Customer Success, and Partnerships to deliver a smooth customer experience and align on partner-led solutions.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Influence product development by adapting quickly to product changes, communicating them strategically to stakeholders, and providing a key voice into future iterations of the product roadmap.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Build and execute a prioritization strategy for managing multiple high-touch customer relationships effectively.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;4+ years in customer-facing SaaS or consulting roles, including hands-on global project management or consulting work supporting complex, enterprise-level organizations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Deep expertise in the Travel &amp;amp; Expense (T&amp;amp;E) industry is preferred, with at least 3+ years of hands-on domain experience. Preference for experience implementing T&amp;amp;E SaaS solutions.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A knack for leading complex customer engagements, with the ability to comfortably manage both technical and non-technical workstreams.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Exceptional communication and problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to resolve issues cross-functionally and deliver creative, customized solutions for a variety of customers.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A proven track record of building customer-centric processes and a strong sense of urgency to drive projects to completion while achieving desired business outcomes.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Hands-on implementation experience with Financial, Expense Management, or ERP software.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Additional domain expertise in any of the following areas: General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Billing, Procurement, or Corporate Card Program Management.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $145,544 - $181,930 USD.&amp;nbsp; However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Enterprise Implementation Consultant, Financial Saas

title: Enterprise Implementation Consultant, Financial Saas

job_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Sales at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;Sales is the growth engine at Brex. We bring in new customers, expand existing relationships, and drive the company’s bottom line. With unlimited territories and uncapped opportunity, your ambition sets the ceiling. We win together, celebrate often, and reward performance. If you want to sell a category-defining product with real ownership, this is your team.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What You’ll Do&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;As a Growth Client Sales Executive at Brex, you will play a key role in driving growth by engaging existing customers and developing new business opportunities. In this role, you will combine your sales and relationship-building skills to identify opportunities and implement strategies that recover and grow our share of wallet. You will work with cross-functional teams, learning from experienced professionals across different areas to expand your skills and knowledge.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;This role will be based in our San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, or Salt Lake City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Spend Recapture Strategy: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute plans to recapture and boost credit card spend among existing customers who have demonstrated higher spending in the past.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Drive and Execute Pipeline: Qualify leads and convert them into qualified opportunities; evaluate accounts and design strategic outreach campaigns to build pipeline; increase revenue by securing spend agreements between parties.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Customer Engagement: Contact customers via phone, email, and other channels to understand their needs, resolve concerns, and highlight the benefits of increasing their card spend with Brex.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Relationship Building: Build and sustain strong relationships with customers, understanding their business objectives, and customize solutions that align with their financial goals.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Data-Driven Approach: Use data analysis and customer insights to identify trends and patterns, allowing the creation of personalized offers and targeted communication to recapture spend.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;2+ years of hands-on experience in Sales roles within B2B SaaS or Payments&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong communication and negotiation skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze customer behavior&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Goal-oriented and self-motivated, with a proven track record of meeting and exceeding targets&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-velocity environment&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Coachability and grit, with an interest in growing your sales career&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity with financial products, credit cards, and business finance&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience with credit card management, including understanding limits, rewards, and underwriting&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge of the competitive landscape, industry trends, and market dynamics&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiar with sales tools like Gong, Salesforce, Outreach, and others&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Holds a Series 7 license&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is USD $132,888 - $166,110. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance.&amp;nbsp; Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;li&gt;Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze customer behavior&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Goal-oriented and self-motivated, with a proven track record of meeting and exceeding targets&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-velocity environment&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Coachability and grit, with an interest in growing your sales career&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity with financial products, credit cards, and business finance&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience with credit card management, including understanding limits, rewards, and underwriting&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge of the competitive landscape, industry trends, and market dynamics&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiar with sales tools like Gong, Salesforce, Outreach, and others&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Holds a Series 7 license&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is USD $122,026 - $152,533. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;2+ years of hands-on experience in Sales roles within B2B SaaS or Payments&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong communication and negotiation skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze customer behavior&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Goal-oriented and self-motivated, with a proven track record of meeting and exceeding targets&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-velocity environment&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Coachability and grit, with an interest in growing your sales career&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity with financial products, credit cards, and business finance&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience with credit card management, including understanding limits, rewards, and underwriting&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge of the competitive landscape, industry trends, and market dynamics&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiar with sales tools like Gong, Salesforce, Outreach, and others&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Holds a Series 7 license&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is USD $122,026 - $152,533. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance.&amp;nbsp; Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Growth Client Sales Executive
location: New York, New York, United States
locations: New York, New York, United States

job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Sales at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;Sales is the growth engine at Brex. We bring in new customers, expand existing relationships, and drive the company’s bottom line. With unlimited territories and uncapped opportunity, your ambition sets the ceiling. We win together, celebrate often, and reward performance. If you want to sell a category-defining product with real ownership, this is your team.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What You’ll Do&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;As a Growth Client Sales Executive at Brex, you will play a key role in driving growth by engaging existing customers and developing new business opportunities. In this role, you will combine your sales and relationship-building skills to identify opportunities and implement strategies that recover and grow our share of wallet. You will work with cross-functional teams, learning from experienced professionals across different areas to expand your skills and knowledge.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;This role will be based in our San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, or Salt Lake City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Spend Recapture Strategy: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute plans to recapture and boost credit card spend among existing customers who have demonstrated higher spending in the past.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Drive and Execute Pipeline: Qualify leads and convert them into qualified opportunities; evaluate accounts and design strategic outreach campaigns to build pipeline; increase revenue by securing spend agreements between parties.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Customer Engagement: Contact customers via phone, email, and other channels to understand their needs, resolve concerns, and highlight the benefits of increasing their card spend with Brex.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Relationship Building: Build and sustain strong relationships with customers, understanding their business objectives, and customize solutions that align with their financial goals.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Data-Driven Approach: Use data analysis and customer insights to identify trends and patterns, allowing the creation of personalized offers and targeted communication to recapture spend.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;2+ years of hands-on experience in Sales roles within B2B SaaS or Payments&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong communication and negotiation skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze customer behavior&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Goal-oriented and self-motivated, with a proven track record of meeting and exceeding targets&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-velocity environment&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Coachability and grit, with an interest in growing your sales career&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity with financial products, credit cards, and business finance&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience with credit card management, including understanding limits, rewards, and underwriting&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge of the competitive landscape, industry trends, and market dynamics&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiar with sales tools like Gong, Salesforce, Outreach, and others&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Holds a Series 7 license&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is USD $122,026 - $152,533. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance.&amp;nbsp; Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Growth Client Sales Executive

job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;People&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The People team builds and sustains the culture that powers Brex. We focus on talent, growth, and the employee experience — creating an environment where high-agency individuals can thrive. From hiring to development, we design systems that grow with scale and challenge people to reach their potential. It’s a team for builders, coaches, and culture-shapers.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you&#39;ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;We’re looking for a seasoned Head of Internal Communications to lead how we communicate strategy, culture, and change across Brex. This role sits at the intersection of business strategy, leadership communication, and organizational storytelling. You’ll work closely with the CEO, CPO, and President to ensure every employee deeply understands where we’re going, why it matters, and how their work connects to company goals.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This is not a traditional “newsletter and all-hands” role. The ideal candidate will be both a strategic business translator and a creative storyteller, capable of simplifying complex business narratives (financial performance, AI strategy, etc) into clear and compelling messages.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our San Francisco office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilites&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Drive strategic clarity:&lt;/strong&gt; Partner with Brex’s leadership team to distill business strategy, financial performance, and company priorities into clear narratives employees can act on and easily understand&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Own executive communications:&lt;/strong&gt; Key driver &amp;amp; partner for CEO and exec messages (all-hands, board updates, internal memos, video scripts, etc.) that reflect transparency, accountability, and inspiration about where the business is going&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Prepare for public company readiness:&lt;/strong&gt; Develop internal comms strategies for public-company-level transparency, governance education, and narrative discipline. Partner with Legal, Finance, and PR/IR to ensure message consistency&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Lead organizational storytelling:&lt;/strong&gt; Build a unified internal narrative that connects our culture (“Be the Founder of Your Career”) with business outcomes and customer impact.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Strengthen change communication:&lt;/strong&gt; Create communication frameworks that help leaders navigate transformation&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Evolve channels and cadence:&lt;/strong&gt; Modernize our communication systems (Slack, all-hands, internal podcasts, etc.) to reach employees where they are—measured by engagement and understanding of our business, not volume&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Coach leaders as communicators:&lt;/strong&gt; Elevate Brex’s leadership bench by developing communication toolkits, templates, and feedback loops that help managers become stronger business translators&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;10+ years of experience in internal communications, executive communications, or corporate affairs, ideally in high-growth technology or fintech companies&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Highly business-savvy: understands P&amp;amp;L drivers, strategy execution, and how communications can drive alignment and results&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience in a public company or late-stage IPO environment; understands regulatory, disclosure, and change-management nuances&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Exceptional writer and storyteller—able to translate complex ideas into plain, memorable language&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Trusted advisor to executives—comfortable navigating sensitive topics and balancing transparency with discretion&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Creative and adaptable: comfortable using AI-powered tools, data-driven measurement, and modern content formats to evolve how Brex communicates&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Passionate about Brex’s mission and culture of ownership, impact, and learning&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $221,480 - $276,850.&amp;nbsp; However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Head of Internal Communications

job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Implementation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Implementation transforms new customers into power users. We lead the onboarding experience for companies adopting Brex Empower, helping them shift from outdated processes to a modern, employee-first approach. It’s a role that blends customer empathy, project management, technical expertise, process design, and change management. We take personal ownership of our customers&#39; long-term success, and we set customers up thoroughly so they can be with ‘Brex for life’. As strategic advisors, we build trust, drive solutions with tenacity, deliver results fast, and work cross-functionally to make adoption seamless for customers.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What You’ll Do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Implementation Consultant role advises and guides customers; ensuring they launch Brex successfully, driving wide adoption, and continually driving business value. Part coach, project manager, consultant, and product expert, our consultants are continually focused on helping our customers improve their financial workflows with Brex.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you’ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our San Francisco office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Work closely with customers to discover their business needs and challenges and then coach them on the best ways to use Brex to solve them&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Play an important role in scoping, consulting, implementing, and achieving customer outcomes with the Brex platform&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Partner with customers &amp;amp; project manage implementations and launches including confirming the project plan, mobilizing stakeholders, and tracking activities through implementation&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Follow best practices to drive spending activity during implementation&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Configure, test, and validate the dashboard with the customer to ensure the product fits their needs and functions as intended&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Oversee the integration of the customer’s accounting software with the Brex platform or partner with Technical Consultants to scope the proper solution&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Manage the customer relationship and expectations, working diligently to provide solutions to any challenges&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Work cross-functionally as a member of the Brex account team to deliver a smooth customer experience, including knowledge sharing and keeping our Sales and Customer Success partners informed on customer engagements&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Adapt quickly to product changes and limitations, and communicate these strategically to stakeholders&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Develop familiarity with the product roadmap and provide a supporting voice into future iterations of the product roadmap&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Build and execute a prioritization strategy for managing multiple high-touch customer relationships&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Provide change management planning to clients including guiding execution of their change management approach. Guide clients on their communication approach, training materials, and training execution&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;3+ years of relevant work experience in a customer-facing role, preferably within a SaaS organization or consulting firm that delivers SaaS services&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;2+ years of project management or consulting experience&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience building processes and programs that benefit customer outcomes&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Comfort-leading customer engagements that may contain both technical and non-technical work streams&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent communication skills, both with customers and within an organization&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Demonstrated ability to provide customized solutions to a variety of customers&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to resolve issues and risks in a cross-functional and collaborative way&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong sense of urgency in driving projects to completion while achieving the desired business outcomes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus Points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Implementation experience in Financial, Expense Management, or ERP Software space&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Domain expertise in any of the following areas: General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Billing, Expense Management, Travel, Procurement and Corporate Card Program&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $119,328 - $149,160 USD. &amp;nbsp;However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Implementation Consultant II

title: Implementation Consultant II

job_city: New York, New York, United States
job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Implementation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Implementation transforms new customers into power users. We lead the onboarding experience for companies adopting Brex Empower, helping them shift from outdated processes to a modern, employee-first approach. It’s a role that blends customer empathy, project management, technical expertise, process design, and change management. We take personal ownership of our customers&#39; long-term success, and we set customers up thoroughly so they can be with ‘Brex for life’. As strategic advisors, we build trust, drive solutions with tenacity, deliver results fast, and work cross-functionally to make adoption seamless for customers.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What You’ll Do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Implementation Consultant role advises and guides customers; ensuring they launch Brex successfully, driving wide adoption, and continually driving business value. Part coach, project manager, consultant, and product expert, our consultants are continually focused on helping our customers improve their financial workflows with Brex.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you’ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our New York City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Work closely with customers to discover their business needs and challenges and then coach them on the best ways to use Brex to solve them&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Play an important role in scoping, consulting, implementing, and achieving customer outcomes with the Brex platform&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Partner with customers &amp;amp; project manage implementations and launches including confirming the project plan, mobilizing stakeholders, and tracking activities through implementation&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Follow best practices to drive spending activity during implementation&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Configure, test, and validate the dashboard with the customer to ensure the product fits their needs and functions as intended&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Oversee the integration of the customer’s accounting software with the Brex platform or partner with Technical Consultants to scope the proper solution&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Manage the customer relationship and expectations, working diligently to provide solutions to any challenges&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Work cross-functionally as a member of the Brex account team to deliver a smooth customer experience, including knowledge sharing and keeping our Sales and Customer Success partners informed on customer engagements&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Adapt quickly to product changes and limitations, and communicate these strategically to stakeholders&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Develop familiarity with the product roadmap and provide a supporting voice into future iterations of the product roadmap&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Build and execute a prioritization strategy for managing multiple high-touch customer relationships&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Provide change management planning to clients including guiding execution of their change management approach. Guide clients on their communication approach, training materials, and training execution&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;3+ years of relevant work experience in a customer-facing role, preferably within a SaaS organization or consulting firm that delivers SaaS services&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;2+ years of project management or consulting experience&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience building processes and programs that benefit customer outcomes&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Comfort-leading customer engagements that may contain both technical and non-technical work streams&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent communication skills, both with customers and within an organization&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Demonstrated ability to provide customized solutions to a variety of customers&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to resolve issues and risks in a cross-functional and collaborative way&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong sense of urgency in driving projects to completion while achieving the desired business outcomes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus Points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Implementation experience in Financial, Expense Management, or ERP Software space&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Domain expertise in any of the following areas: General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Billing, Expense Management, Travel, Procurement and Corporate Card Program&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $119,328 - $149,160 USD. &amp;nbsp;However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Implementation Consultant II
location: New York, New York, United States
locations: New York, New York, United States
